New Records: Jason Holder became the first West Indian to take a hat-trick in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Kieron Pollard top-scored with 41 not out as West Indies made 179 for four.
Jason Holder took 5 wickets for 27 runs, including 4 wickets in 4 balls.
West Indies openers Brandon King and Kyle Mayers shared a stand of 59.
Pollard and Rovman Powell had an unbroken stand of 75, with 66 runs off the last 24 balls.
Akeal Hosein set the tone by dismissing Jason Roy in the first over.
Akeal Hosein took 4 wickets for 30 runs.
West Indies won the match by 17 runs, bowling out England for 162 in 19.5 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Holder expressed happiness with his performance and thanked the crowd for their support.
Kieron Pollard praised his team for their effort and mentioned the importance of runs on the board.
Moeen Ali acknowledged that West Indies were the better team and mentioned the learning experience for England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies clinched the series by a 3-2 margin.
Jason Holder was named Player of the Match and Player of the Series.
